zc.thread
Class UnboundedSharedQueue

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--zc.thread.AbstractSharedQueue
        |
        +--zc.thread.UnboundedSharedQueue
All Implemented Interfaces:
SharedQueue
Deprecated. Conceptually an UnboundedSharedQueue should be, well, unbounded, but in real world an unbounded queue that grow continually will certainly leads to disasters. Thus UnboundedSharedQueue are simulated with a BoundedSharedQueue of a sufficiently large capacity.

public class UnboundedSharedQueue
extends AbstractSharedQueue

A SharedQueue that have no maximum capacity.

Constructor Detail

UnboundedSharedQueue

public UnboundedSharedQueue(int inMaxCapacity)
Deprecated. 
Construct a SharedQueue.

By providing a large but reasonable value for inMaxCapacity we can prevent the queue to grow out of control.

Parameters:
inMaxCapacity - the maximum allowable capacity for the queue.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if inMaxCapacity argument is less than one.

finalize in class java.lang.Object

clear

public void clear()
Deprecated. 
Removes all the objects from this SharedQueue. All waiting threads will be notified.

The SharedQueue will be empty after this call returns.

size

public int size()
Deprecated. 
Description copied from interface: SharedQueue
Returns the number of objects currently enqueued in this SharedQueue.

NOTE: This is only a snapshot value, that may have changed before returning.

Deprecated. 
Description copied from class: AbstractSharedQueue
Put an object into the next free slot and adjust the cursors.

Must imperatively be called from a synchronized block.
